First taxonomist: Genus?
Newt:SEAMONSTER
FT:You’re the size of a twiglet
N: I’m FIERCE
FT:And you eat?
N:*mumbles*
FT:Sorry?
N,quietly: small shrimps 
FT:Habitat?
N:THE TERRIBLE SEA
FT:Really?
N:…
FT:…?
N,grumpily:a pond
FT:What are you?
N,furious:A NEWT OK? Bloody biologists.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: @beccacaddy Shit yes. ‘Oh THAT’s why that’s rock hard. OK, wtf do I do to make it easier?’ The answer is trying to unlearn opinions about ourselves that others’ behaviour has told us since we first went to school. Many of us won’t manage that.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: @FenGar I have cPTSD but caused by things that happened when I was a young adult. Yep, a bloody difficult soup to live in.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: This even applies to friendships I’ve had for decades with people who say they love me & they’re not going anywhere. Not relaying this for self pity but bc it might sound familiar for those with ADHD or suspect they may have it. If you have RSD I’m sending thoughts. It’s tough.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: I’m 50 in a few weeks yet I still go through this every time I meet someone new: ‘Wait, they like me? Wtf’ followed by disbelief. If there’s more evidence they might like to be friends I’ll sometimes be brave enough to reciprocate but I’m constantly expecting them to disappear.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: @YiNebular Hi, I really empathise with you on this. I’m pretty much the same. Understanding why this is is definitely helpful but these are strong pathways laid down at an early age. Best of luck with your diagnosis and with unpicking this stuff. It’s really hard.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: Learning about my conditions & their tricky side dishes is helping me understand why I really struggle with certain things.Unforch the intense feeling of not being good/normal enough to be a friend to anyone doesn’t evaporate just because I have an acronym with which to label it.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: @AndrewRWhite Sending thoughts Andrew. It’s rock hard.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: Even as an adult this can be incredibly difficult to navigate. It can lead to people pleasing (as a safeguard against being dumped), struggling to forge new friendships & good old social anxiety. Even with therapy the effects of RSD on socialising/friendships can be significant.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: ADHD usually comes hand in hand with rejection sensitive dysphoria, yet if we don’t adhere to neurotypical behaviour we’re often rejected, especially when we’re small. This accentuates the RSD & a cycle of low self esteem begins. Even tougher if autism’s part of the brain soup 👎🏻

name: Emma Mitchell 💙

tweet:
You can tell me I need to ignore those coming for me but:
1) I have ADHD, it creates a feeling of everything being equally important 
2) Both my neurodivergent conditions make feelings very intense
3) Part of my ADHD is rejection sensitivity dysphoria
4) I have bullying trauma

tweet: @Valkerr8 Sorry to not respond so positively to your tweet. Though exercise etc is certainly proven to help biochemically, sometimes depression is so severe that movement is almost impossible. Exercise is contingent on the depression being mild enough to summon sufficient motivation.

tweet: I don’t mind losing 100 or so followers, this was an observation showing that we still have some way to go for mental illness, especially more severe/life threatening conditions to be fully accepted. PMDD isn’t widely understood even by drs. There needs to be much more discourse.

tweet: I know that if the dial moves more the darkest thoughts of all arrive. Urge to delete account, then urge to delete myself. Those thoughts aren’t here yet thankfully. To know that a normal endocrine shift changes my thoughts so drastically is terrifying, but that’s what happens.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: It’s become frightening anger towards myself and anything I’ve made. My objectivity about my PMDD, which is a thought pathway I’ve laid down in the last 2 years, is just about still working, which is why I’m typing this but my urge to delete this account is almost overwhelming.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: It’s taken several years to learn about  & become sufficiently aware of this while it’s happening to do the brain chemistry thing-it’s feels like positivity being dialled right down, I can feel it happening so I take action, but today it’s so bad that it’s turned inward.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: A few days a year my PMDD, a genetic sensitivity to low progesterone causing cyclical severe/sometimes dangerous depression, is so bad that my thoughts go into a different mode. Rather than finding ways to change my brain chemistry so I can ride it out, I become self destructive.

tweet: Also called red-tailed mason bees, Osmia bicornis. Very small, males 6-11mm, females a little larger, dark brown/black but with varying amounts of gingery hair on their very round abdomens. name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: When my second book was featured on Springwatch in 2020, one of the super frosty we-don’t-like-brain-injuries-here women invited me over for tea. Because...it absolved me from the horrible life shit? I politely declined 👀. I’m banging on, sorry, but I needed to write this down.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: I was increasingly reclusive but I made a few real life friends through my blog & they didn’t chuck me down the bog if I talked about difficult stuff. In 2010 I ran a project on the blog called ‘Splash of colour’for crafters who found winter hard. It led to my book Making Winter.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: So I wrote on my blog, about silver clay, about cow parsley, about the gorgeous tiny people I was trying to be a mum to. I didn’t write about the brain injury, or the rehab(the life support stayed on), or the miraculous fact of my sibling’s survival. I didn’t mention depression.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: And I’d try to walk round the village with my gorgeous babies for whom we’d moved to this ‘lovely’ place, and more than once those women saw me and rushed into their houses. Because they didn’t want to hear about a truly beautiful brain that was total soup. Because er, Jesus? idk

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: About intensive care & how my only sibling’s life support would be turned off that day. Yeah, I went waaay wide of the neat-garden-prestige-job-chocolate-box-cottage rules that day, at the baby group I was running. So, I was Out. Result: severe depression & reclusiveness.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: Others have asked me how I deal with living here-I didn’t realise but this village has a reputation for politics, for excluding people who aren’t considered...suitable. People who don’t adhere to the rules. It seems I broke the rules by talking about a catastrophic brain injury.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: This isn’t a cheery thread,except that this Twitter feed & 2 soon-to-be 3 books exist as a result of what happened.I’d immersed myself in this small community for my girls’ sake:run craft fairs,made what I thought were friends,started the tiny baby group from which I was excluded

FIRST BRIMSTONE 
BUTTERFLY of 2022.
Gonepteryx rhamni.
It’s thought to be the original ‘butter fly’as it’s as yellow as butter. The first sighting of this species is one of the signposts at the beginning of spring, along with eg. the first blossom & hearing the first chiffchaff. https://t.co/rcqUXkd6xW

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: @mrsajdubs I couldn’t believe it at first, but the village is so small that I’d see them walking past my window on the way to the small baby group THAT I HAD STARTED and I had to come to terms with it somehow.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙

name: Emma Mitchell 💙

tweet:
I look back now & realise that yes, I was maybe a bit too honest about that close family member being close to death, but I hardly bawled my eyes out. What unfolded was some hardcore cruel Stepford shit that destroyed my mental health & social confidence. 
PS they’re Christians.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: My tweets (& books) are an attempt to return the favour-to maybe create something that someone who’s feeling low & alone might be able to hold on to. Anyhow those women (who are still my neighbours & still blank me) can fuck all the way off, as can the words of that person 🖕🏻.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: I became horribly isolated with a newborn, a toddler and a family who were far away who needed me to emotionally support them. The blog was a way to talk to people, to not feel completely alone. Without realising it that group of crafters helped me through years of difficulty.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: I sometimes waffle on when I should keep my twit shut,but the main reason I post here is bc in 2008 some women in my tiny Fenland village fully ostracised me for having a family member in a coma & crying a bit about it so I started a craft blog to try to find likeminded people.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: Recently someone offline who really wanted to hurt me told me Twitter was narcissistic & my tweets obviously  must be too. They don’t read my tweets & they don’t know the purpose of them. In the past I would have fallen into depression at this, but it was their stuff, not mine 💪🏻

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: Overwhelm’s rife right now. I’ve written a book about this yet I often forget how intense the relief can be from just STANDING among plants. Walking for 10-15 mins in a green place adds endorphins to the good soup. Nature can really help with incessant headline-induced anxiety.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet:
cont’d:
🌿inhaling plant oils (more in the air on warmer days) dials stress hormone down 
🐦 birdsong’s been shown to be more effective than meditation apps at inducing relaxation
💙 seeing colours pink &/or blue alleviates stress

We’re hardwired to feel calmer in a green space. https://t.co/N7jUMMaPil

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet:
Was stressed so stood in the garden for 5 mins. Almost instant relief was caused by:
🌿relaxation response from seeing patterns of leaves & the colour green
🌸dopamine from seeing early spring flowers
☀️serotonin release from sunshine & contact with soil bacteria
It really works. https://t.co/iZ7nWYbdyE

tweet: @spectral_song Sound waves aren’t connected to the electromagnetic spectrum. They’re waves of oxygen/nitrogen other air molecules, like waves of water molecules create waves in a lake.

description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: @spectral_song ...and ‘colour therapy’ I think refers to the differing but overlapping responses triggered in the human visual cortex in response to different wavelengths. These pathways and responses are primarily linked to ancestral foraging.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: Bc the thoughts are so bad that I can barely move, Twitter’s a lifeline on these days. Small good things: trees, embroidery, a bluetit, a joke, a very good dog. It’s helped my brain stay away from the dangerous stuff hundreds of times. You help without realising it, so thankyou x

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: My brain’s ill today, caused by a genetic wonk in its response to low progesterone. It causes super hardcore depression for 3-5 days every 4 weeks. I’m having treatment that removes the urgent need for A & E & allows me to see what’s happening but doesn’t stop the bad thoughts.

Long tailed tit, Aegithalos caudatus. Its colloquial names include flying teaspoon, hedge jug & bumbarrel. Its egg-shaped nest is made of moss strands & lichen fragments ‘sewn’ together with stretchy spider silk.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet:
Something I’ve realised is part of ADHD is *drumroll* Rejection Sensitivity Dysphoria.Say someone doesn’t answer an email for a while-normal conclusion:they’re v busy/went into spam. Intrusive ADHD thoughts:’IT’S BC THEY THINK UR A 🔔🔚.’
Knackering & can lead to sad thoughts 👎🏻.

tweet:
Ernest was an elephant and very well intentioned,
Leonard was a lion with a brave new tail,
George was a goat, as I think I have mentioned,
but James was only a snail.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet:
Earnest started trumpeting and raised such a rumpus,
Leonard started roaring and trying to kick,
James went on a journey with the goats new compass
And he reached the end of his brick.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet:
Earnest started trumpeting, and cracked his manger,
Leonard started roaring, and shivered his stall,
James gave a huffle of a snail in danger

tweet:
Individual sections of crinoid skeleton from the stem are called OSSICLES (new favourite word). Here’s a whole fossilised crinoid & its lovely ossicle-y stem. Cool paleontological info from the utterly brilliant  @palaeokatie who you should follow immediately.
(📷@BritGeoSurvey) https://t.co/PEQh8mILdb

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: The cheerio is part of the fossilised ‘stem’ of a crinoid. These sea creatures PREDATED DINOSAURS, were related to sea urchins & starfish,looked like a flower, filter fed on plankton & had 5 axes of symmetry. Some crinoids are still living (🤍) & here are some Ernst Haeckel drew: https://t.co/fYubgK1GHH

tweet: Might list more later, but putting these here in case they help-in case you’re wondering about your own brain. Doing/experiencing these things doesn’t necessarily  mean you’re autistic, but it might be an indicator, a clue.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: @AlabasterMiss Yes, especially when I say ‘I can’t process all this, I might need a minute’ and...someone isn’t nice about it.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: 3) Sensory processing things: the feeling of treading on small lumps or bits of something with bare feet is 👎🏻. More than two people talking at once and I can’t process any of the words. Certain loud metallic sounds feel quite stabby in my brain.

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet: 2) This sort of thing 👇🏻 that I’ve been doing/making since I was very small. Collections, things arranged neatly, by colour or shape, categorised and often labelled. Tiny tabletop museums: the process of making them calms and quietens my brain and gives me a gentle high. https://t.co/TRr5pNG5sh

name: Emma Mitchell 💙
description: Sunday Times bestselling author, @bbcspringwatch, Guardian etc #mentalhealth & brain biochemistry #TheWildRemedy | autistic,ADHD |🏳️‍🌈| Agent:@julietpickering
tweet:
Things I’ve realised are probably my (recently diagnosed) autism:
1) A very strong, not unpleasant brain reaction to sharp flavours eg lemon, tangfastics, pickled onion monster munch. It’s like...tangy lightning. Daughters call it my ‘lemon face’- there’s quite a bit of wincing.
